snippet: The city has planned a full day of remembrance to commemorate the deaths of four young girls: Addie Mae Collins, Denise McNair, Carole Robertson and Cynthia Wesley.
abstract: Editorial notes that city of Birmingham, Ala, has planned a full day of remembrance to commemorate 50th anniversary of bombing of 16th Street Baptist Church in 1963; contends it is important to pause and remember how difficult the path toward justice and equality was for the civil rights movement, and to recall that it was a struggle of good against segregation that was seen as the natural order of things.
lead_paragraph: The city has planned a full day of remembrance to commemorate the deaths of four young girls: Addie Mae Collins, Denise McNair, Carole Robertson and Cynthia Wesley.
